To zerilo and others having issues:

1 - Copy the files in the crack to :

C:Program Files (x86)2K GamesGearbox SoftwareBorderlands 2BinariesWin32

or wherever you have the game installed to.

2- Edit the 3DMGame.ini file and change the line PlayerName ="" to PlayerName ="YOURPLAYERNAME" (with quotes)

3-Play !

3.1-If you want to play online go to 
tunngle and download Tunngle and create an account.

3.2-Follow the instructions at :
tunngle wiki for Borderlands_2 to find out how to configure everything.

Post here if you need more help but with this release and those instructions we've been playing online for many hours without any issues. Make sure to open port UDP 11155 on your firewall and router.

I used the Skidrow release of BL2 and even after update 1, it just would not load - only the language selection tool, and the config tool would work. I had performed the crack and firewall operations correctly, and run BL2 as Admin, but to no avail.. After using this crack, however, it loads just fine. 

I'm looking forward to some gameplay after many hours of head-scratching trying to get the game to run at all. 


@lolindir356: I have not got Steam installed at all, so thats not a requirement

This crack works just fine without Steam.  It's why I'm using it instead of one of the Skidrow updates.  The only issues I see that might be put on the crack are that there is some stuttering in a couple of the early areas of the game where every 2-3 seconds my game freezes for a split second.

Still, I'll take that over a Steam crack that requires you to have Steam installed anyways.  Never saw the point in having Steam on my PC, and I see even less point in installing it just so a "Steam crack" will work.

GETTING THE DX9 "CRASH AFTER A FEW MINUTES" UNREAL ENGINE BUG?

(D3DERR_DRIVERINTERNALERROR, video stops, sound continues)

Here's how to get around it:
Edit "my games/Borderlands 2/WillowGame/config/WillowEngine.ini" line 219, change False to True:

[Engine.ISVHacks]
bInitializeShadersOnDemand=True

Thanks a lot to you. It works now. Thanks again.
